doc.after: At the Macworld Conference & Expo in January 2007, Steve Jobs introduced the long-anticipated[181] iPhone, a convergence of an Internet-enabled smartphone and iPod.[182] The first-generation iPhone was released on June 29, 2007 for $499 (4Â GB) and $599 (8Â GB) with an AT&T contract.[183] On February 5, 2008, it was updated to have 16Â GB of memory, in addition to the 8Â GB and 4Â GB models.[184] It combined a 2.5G quad band GSM and EDGE cellular phone with features found in handheld devices, running scaled-down versions of Apple's Mac OS X (dubbed iPhone OS, later renamed iOS), with various Mac OS X applications such as Safari and Mail. It also includes web-based and Dashboard apps such as Google Maps and Weather. The iPhone features a 3.5-inch (89Â mm) touchscreen display, Bluetooth, and Wi-Fi (both "b" and "g").[182]
